title: Drawing, "The Partheonon and the Erectheion, Athens, Greece", April 1869
markings:
Recto:  Stamped in ink, at lower center:  Lugt 457c
Verso:  Stamped in ink, at lower center:  Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with numbers at various locations; again, at upper right: 2- blue sky / 3- sunlight on stone;again, at center upper right:  blue; again, at center left:  green / green (blocks) / rock; again, at center: green / rock in steps / warm / grass; again, at lower right:  4- bricks / 5- granite; and again, at bottom center: April / 69
description: Horizontal view of the west side of the Parthenon in the right middleground; the southern side of the Erechtheion in the center; indistinct fragments in the left middleground; architectural fragments in the right and central foreground; and a headless female statue, probably Athena, in the front of a flight of rock-cut steps beneath the Parthenon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Partheonon and the Erectheion, Athens, Greece", April 1869.
April 1869. Graphite on green-gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-325.
